title.narrative: CHILD CARE SYSTEM STRENGTHENING AND CCTE/CP

description.narrative: By 2020, the national child protection system (including the social service workforce) have increased capacity to expand the coverage and quality of the child protection services for vulnerable children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participationBy 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participation.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

title.narrative: Turkey United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the national child protection system (including the social service workforce) have increased capacity to expand the coverage and quality of the child protection services for vulnerable children

description.narrative: Case management systems and other elements of the statutory child protection system were enhanced. National capacity to provide outreach services was strengthened through the operationalization of additional Family Support Teams of the Ministry of Family, Labour and Social Services in the 15 provinces with the highest number of refugees. In these same provinces the child protection component of the Conditional Cash Transfer for Education programme for refugees reached 17,334 vulnerable refugee children and their families. UNICEF also supported the Turkish government to accelerate child care reform and deinstitutionalization processes as well as to improve the foster care system. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: Social welfare workforce strengthened and connected to social protection system (case management, referral capacity development)

baseline.value: 0 - No connection between social welfare workforce and social protection system (as of mid-2017)

target.value: 2020:2 ¿ Strong connection between social welfare workforce and social protection system.

actual.value: 2019:Score : 1.5 - Linkages with Child Protection strengthened: A national workshop with the participation of MoFLSS staff and CCTE CP staff with a view to promote coordination and synergies organized. MoFLSS established a task force Joint field visits organized

title.narrative: # of refugee and host community children assessed for protection needs by State-coordinated outreach teams
An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country

baseline.value: No Alternative care policies in line with the 2009 Guidelines exist but its implementation is fragmented. Current policies address the needs of children with specific vulnerabilities to a very limited extent only. In addition, review mechanisms and monitoring of cases remains insufficient. Finally foster care options need to be strengthened.

target.value: 2020:Partially: Alternative care options are strengthened for children with disabilities. Review mechanism for CWD in place. Emergency foster care system is in place. Care standard for UASC improved.

actual.value:
2019:Specialised training programme for foster care families for CwD developed
SOPs for emergency foster care system drafted
Self assessment system for child care institutions for UASC adopted

title.narrative: Child Protection System has both preventative and responsive services available and there is a framework for coordination

baseline.value: Some components of the CP system across the continuum of care are in place

actual.value:
2019:86 staff recruited in 21 Social Services Centers in 15 provinces.
649 ASDEP nationwide staff were trained on prevention of sexual abuse and on working with trauma.
A team of international consultants has now been seconded to develop the child protection and case management training programme for
